trans-unit.source: Represents a control that lets users attach typed text or handwritten annotations to documents.
A sticky note provides a rectangular area whose content is separate from the text, image, or other material to which the note is anchored.
The StickyNoteControl class and its members are public so that it can be styled, but is no public constructor.

Instances are created with the <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationService.CreateTextStickyNoteCommand> and <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationService.CreateInkStickyNoteCommand> of the <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationService> class.

When a sticky note is created, it is designated as one of two types: - **Text** sticky notes have a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RichTextBox> content area that can be written and edited like any other Rich Text area.
Users can type into it and can also cut, copy, and paste both within the note and between the note and other applications.
Images can also be pasted into the note.
The usual Rich Text keyboard shortcuts are also available.
- **Ink** sticky notes have an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> content area and it can be edited like other ink canvasses.
For example, strokes can be erased.
With a tablet PC or other suitable hardware, users can enter handwritten notes.

The [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ui](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-ui-md.md)] of the StickyNoteControl makes it a more powerful way to annotate material than marking up a hardcopy or using physical handwritten notes.
It is also more flexible than simply adding to, or striking through, the text of a document.
- Sticky notes can be resized.
- Sticky notes can be minimized to an icon and expanded.
- When maximized, a sticky note can be dragged to a new position in a window without changing the location of its anchor.
- The exact content to which a sticky note applies is highlighted and marked off with brackets.
- Two or more sticky notes can apply to the same content or to overlapping content.
- When change occurs within the document content to which a sticky note is anchored, the sticky note's position moves in position relative to the content to which it was bound.
- With text sticky notes, lines will wrap automatically.
If the note is resized, lines will re-wrap as needed.
If content extends below the bottom of the note, a vertical scroll bar will appear.
- With ink sticky notes, vertical and horizontal scroll bars will appear whenever content extends beyond the boundaries of the note.
Gets an object that provides information about the annotated object.
This property enables you to match the sticky note with the corresponding annotated object.
AnchorInfo is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
An <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.IAnchorInfo"></xref> object that provides information about the annotated object.
Gets the name of the author who created the sticky note.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
The name of the author who created the sticky note.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl.Author*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets the font family of the caption for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl"></xref>.
We recommend that you do not attempt to get a reference to an instance of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl> nor, hence, that you read or write this property directly.
This property should be used only in styling <xref:System.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl>s.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`||
A <xref href="System.Drawing.FontFamily"></xref> for the control's caption.
The default is the value of <xref:System.Windows.SystemFonts.MessageFontFamily*>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl.CaptionFontFamily*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets the size of the font used for the caption of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl"></xref>.
We recommend that you do not attempt to get a reference to an instance of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl> nor, hence, that you read or write this property directly.
This property should be used only in styling <xref:System.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl>s.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`||
A <xref:System.Double> representing the font size.
The default is the value of <xref:System.Windows.SystemFonts.MessageFontSize*>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl.CaptionFontSize*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets the degree to which the font used for the caption of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl"></xref> is stretched.
We recommend that you do not attempt to get a reference to an instance of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl> nor, hence, that you read or write this property directly.
This property should be used only in styling <xref:System.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl>s.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`||
A <xref href="System.Windows.FontStretch"></xref> structure representing the degree of stretching compared to a font's normal aspect ratio.
The default is <xref:System.Windows.FontStretches.Normal*>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl.CaptionFontStretch*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets the style of the font used for the caption of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl"></xref>.
We recommend that you do not attempt to get a reference to an instance of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl> nor, hence, that you read or write this property directly.
This property should be used only in styling <xref:System.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl>s.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`||
A <xref href="System.Windows.FontStyle"></xref> structure representing the style of the caption as normal, italic, or oblique.
The default is the value of <xref:System.Windows.SystemFonts.MessageFontStyle*>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl.CaptionFontStyle*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets the weight of the font used for the caption of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl"></xref>.
We recommend that you do not attempt to get a reference to an instance of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl> nor, hence, that you read or write this property directly.
This property should be used only in styling <xref:System.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl>s.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`||
A <xref href="System.Windows.FontWeight"></xref> structure representing the weight of the font, for example, bold, ultrabold, or extralight.
The default is the value of <xref:System.Windows.SystemFonts.MessageFontWeight*>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl.CaptionFontWeight*> dependency property.
To be added.
Represents a command whose <xref:System.Windows.Input.RoutedCommand.Execute*> method deletes a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl"></xref>.
To be added.
Represents a command whose <xref:System.Windows.Input.RoutedCommand.Execute*> method will switch the cursor in an ink sticky note to one of several possible modes, including draw and erase.
When used, the InkCommand takes a parameter of type <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvasEditingMode>.
The command's <xref:System.Windows.Input.RoutedCommand.Execute%2A> method will put the cursor in the mode specified by the parameter.
To be added.
Gets the Xml type of the ink sticky note annotation.
To be added.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl"></xref> is active.
We recommend that you do not attempt to get a reference to an instance of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl> nor, hence, that you read this property directly.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`||
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the control is active; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl.IsActive*> dependency property.
The identifier for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl.IsActive%2A> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl"></xref> is expanded.
We recommend that you do not attempt to get a reference to an instance of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl> nor, hence, that you read or write this property directly.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the control is expanded; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl.IsExpanded*> dependency property.
The identifier for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl.IsExpanded%2A> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets a value indicating whether the mouse cursor is over the anchor of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl"></xref>.
We recommend that you do not attempt to get a reference to an instance of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl> nor, hence, that you read this property directly.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the mouse cursor is over the anchor; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl.IsMouseOverAnchor*> dependency property.
The identifier for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl.IsMouseOverAnchor%2A> dependency property.
To be added.
Registers event handlers for all the children of a template.
OnApplyTemplate is performed automatically after the control applies an ink or text sticky note template to the control.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
Gets or sets the width of the pen for an ink <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl"></xref>.
We recommend that you do not attempt to get a reference to an instance of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl> nor, hence, that you read or write this property directly.
This property should be used only in styling <xref:System.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl>s.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|,
<xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.AffectsRender%2A>|
A <xref:System.Double> representing the width of the pen.
The default is the value of <xref:System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.Width*>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl.PenWidth*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets a value that indicates whether the sticky note is text or ink.
An ink <xref:System.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl> can be used for handwritten notes on a tablet PC or other hardware that supports handwritten input.
We recommend that you do not attempt to get a reference to an instance of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl> nor, hence, that you read this property directly.
This property should be used only in styling <xref:System.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl>s.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
A <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteType"></xref> value indicating the type of note.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteType"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl.StickyNoteType*> dependency property.
The identifier for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.StickyNoteControl.StickyNoteType%2A> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets the Xml type of the text sticky note annotation.
To be added.
